headline.main: Spain's Ex-PM Meets With Jailed Venezuelan Opposition Leader
headline.print_headline: Spain's Ex-PM Meets With Jailed Venezuelan Opposition Leader

docs.snippet: Spain's former prime minister met with jailed Venezuelan opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez on Saturday, the first meeting of its kind in more than two years. The prison visit was part of a high-risk diplomatic effort to defuse Venezuela's escalatin...
docs.lead_paragraph: Spain's former prime minister met with jailed Venezuelan opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez on Saturday, the first meeting of its kind in more than two years. The prison visit was part of a high-risk diplomatic effort to defuse Venezuela's escalating crisis.

headline.main: For Jim Courier, Remembering When America’s Big 4 Ruled the Men’s Game
headline.print_headline: When America’s Big 4  Ruled the Men’s Game

docs.snippet: It has been 25 years since Courier beat his Compatriot Andre Agassi for the French Open title, a time when American men dominated tennis....
docs.abstract: Article recalls men's final of 1991 French Open tennis tournament between Jim Courier and Andre Agassi, last time two American men competed for title at Roland Garros; Courier, at 20 years old and seeded ninth, shocked many in tennis world with run to his first major title.
docs.lead_paragraph: It has been 25 years since Courier beat his Compatriot Andre Agassi for the French Open title, a time when American men dominated tennis.

headline.main: Jurgen Klinsmann Brushes Off Opening Loss for U.S. Team in Copa América
headline.print_headline: U.S. Coach Brushes Off a Loss

docs.snippet: The Americans had obvious problems in a 2-0 defeat against Colombia, but Klinsmann chose to look on the bright side....
docs.abstract: Andrew Keh On Soccer column applauds professionalism of United States men's national soccer coach Klinsmann after team's loss to Colombia in opening game of Copa America soccer tournament.

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The Americans had obvious problems in a 2-0 defeat against Colombia, but Klinsmann chose to look on the bright side.

docs.snippet: KROSS--Nathan, passed away peacefully on June 4th at the age of 92. Born in Ellenville, NY, a lover of farms and ice cream. He ran the family business Adelman Foods for more than 65 years. Beloved husband of Laura for 70 years, father of June, Ian...
docs.lead_paragraph:
KROSS--Nathan,

passed away peacefully on June 4th at the age of 92. Born in Ellenville, NY, a lover of farms and ice cream. He ran the family business Adelman Foods for more than 65 years. Beloved husband of Laura for 70 years, father of June, Ian and Peter. Wonderful Poppop to his granddaughters, Sara, Amanda and Elle, and his great-grandson Lachlan.

docs.snippet: WEIL--Ernst, passed away peacefully at his home in Zurich on June 2, 2016 at the age of 86, surrounded by his family and loved ones. Born in Zurich, he moved to New York in 1940 with his parents and sister, where he grew up as an American teenager...
docs.lead_paragraph:
WEIL--Ernst,

passed away peacefully at his home in Zurich on June 2, 2016 at the age of 86, surrounded by his family and loved ones. Born in Zurich, he moved to New York in 1940 with his parents and sister, where he grew up as an American teenager: attending high school in Manhattan; going to Summer Camp; and taking summer jobs as a delivery boy for Eclair. The family returned to Switzerland in 1944, yet the years in New York proved formative. American characteristics such as openness and drive melded with his European sensibility and warmth. Throughout his life he continued to spend long periods of time in the US - learning the textile business prior to joining his family's firm in the early 50's, attending Harvard University's AMP program in 1972, and as CEO of Phibro Energy Corporation and Executive Vice President of Salomon Brothers from 1986 to 1993, where he had joined in 1975. Preceded in death ten years ago by his beloved wife Jacqueline Weil-Bloch, he is survived by his children Corinne (Ofer), Denis, Nathalie (Shlomo) and Philippe (Orly), nine grandchildren, his sister Hermine Bader, his companion Marianne Lang and family and friends throughout the world. Donations in his memory may be made to AFIM, the American Friends of the Israel Museum.

docs.snippet: TILZER-RHODES--Louise. NewYork-Presbyterian mourns the death of Louise Tilzer-Rhodes, beloved wife of our Life Trustee William R. Rhodes. A beautiful woman of grace and elegance, Louise will be deeply missed by all who knew her. We extend our deep...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TILZER-RHODES--Louise.

NewYork-Presbyterian mourns the death of Louise Tilzer-Rhodes, beloved wife of our Life Trustee William R. Rhodes. A beautiful woman of grace and elegance, Louise will be deeply missed by all who knew her. We extend our deepest sympathies to Bill, her daughter Jessica and all of Louise's loved ones. Frank A. Bennack, Jr., Chairman of the Board of Trustees Steven J. Corwin, MD, President and CEO Herbert Pardes, MD, Executive Vice Chair of the Board of Trustees NewYork-Presbyterian
